snippet: Boston, which will play the Knicks on Monday in Madison Square Garden, is 2-0 since Coach Doc Rivers began using the starting five he envisioned at the start of the season.
abstract: Boston Celtics are 2-0 since coach Doc Rivers has been able to use starting five he envisioned at the start of the season, lineup that had to wait for Avery Bradley to return from off-season surgery on both shoulders; Rivers had used seven starting lineups waiting for Bradley to return.
lead_paragraph: Boston, which will play the Knicks on Monday in Madison Square Garden, is 2-0 since Coach Doc Rivers began using the starting five he envisioned at the start of the season.

headline.main: Celtics’ Outlook Brightens With the Lineup They Wanted All Along
headline.print_headline: Celtics’ Outlook Brightens With the Lineup They Wanted All Along
